results.title: Adelaide celebrations
results.creator_credit: Penny Chapman, Terry Jennings, Lesley Hammond and South Australian Film Corporation
results.brief_description: Excerpts from the many theatre arts and crafts on display at Adelaide Festival time. An interesting study of Adelaide at the time of its biennial festival of the arts, in 1976.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Penny Chapman, Terry Jennings, Lesley Hammond and South Australian Film Corporation

results.title: Adelaide's Christmas pageant
results.creator_credit: G Shepherd and South Australian Government Tourist Bureau
results.brief_description: Presents an annual Adelaide folk event - the Christmas pageant - through the eyes of a small boy. The procession winds its way through crowds of people, with no commentary, only the sounds of Adelaide enjoying the occasion. The pageant is sponsored and presented by a department store but without direct advertising.

results.title: Addition with mixed numerals
results.creator_credit: Harry D Ruderman, General Learning Corporation and Davidson Films
results.brief_description: Big John, the coal miner, has trouble adding mixed numbers. Fortunately, Big John, with the aid of his parrot, learns to organise the tallies by adding the whole numbers and the fractional parts.

results.title: Addio tradizione
results.creator_credit: Anna Louise Sortini, South Australian Film Corporation and Open Window Productions
results.brief_description: Childhood memories are recalled whilst Sylvanna (Marcella Russo), a housewife, ponders her adolescent years with migrant Italian parents in Australia. A series of moving images show the Italian customs experienced throughout her childhood and the growing tensions and difficulties in the family as she reaches puberty and the two cultures of differing family values clash.

results.title: Adaptive radiation: the mollusks
results.creator_credit: John Walker and Encyclopaedia Britannica Films
results.brief_description: Illustrates the principles of adaptive radiation and shows how the typical molluscan characteristics are modified in each of the six classes. Suitable for upper secondary level.

results.title: Adaptations of insects. - 2nd ed.
results.brief_description: Shows the ways in which insects are adapted to their environments. Considers the functions of legs, mouths, breathing organs and camouflage in allowing the various insects to survive in the particular environments. Suitable for upper primary, lower and middle secondary levels.

results.title: Adaptation
results.creator_credit: Spike Jonze, Jonathan Demme, Vincent Landay, Edward Saxon, Intermedia and Columbia
results.brief_description: From the creators of “Being John Malkovich” - director Spike Jonze and screenwriter Charlie Kaufman - comes the strangely twisted tale of woe of a screenwriter given the task of adapting a novel to the screen. In a desperate struggle, he actually writes himself (and his twin brother) into the story and reality and fiction start to blur, creating some dramatic and at times, comic situations. Cast includes Nicholas Cage, Meryl Streep and Chris Cooper (Academy Award Winner Best Supporting Actor for this role). Screenplay by Charlie and Donald Kaufman. “Adaptation” is also winner of two Golden Globe Awards. Based on the book “The Orchard Thief” by Susan Orlean.

results.title: Adapt to change or leave the land
results.creator_credit: Tom Carroll, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI
results.brief_description: As Tom Carroll reflects on five generations of his family and their land at Mudgeegonga in northern Victoria. In doing so, he recalls the various challenges his ancestors faced, as well as the changes they needed to accomodate, much in the same way he has to today.

results.title: Adam Smith and The Wealth of Nations
results.creator_credit: John Haggarty, Jean Wadlow, Liberty Fund and Charles Barker Films
results.brief_description: Studies the life and works of Adam Smith, the Scottish political economist and philosopher whose book “The Wealth of Nations” was completed two hundred years ago. Outlines many of Smith’s most interesting and controversial theories.

results.title: Adam's rib
results.creator_credit: George Cukor, Lawrence Weingarten and Metro-Goldwyn-Mayer
results.brief_description: Katharine Hepburn plays Amanda Bonner, the defence attorney in the trial of Doris Attinger for the attempted murder of her husband whom she discovers has a mistress. Spencer Tracy is Amanda’s husband, Adam, prosecuting attorney in the same trial. As the trial progresses, Amanda and Adam find they cannot confine their battle to the courtroom, as the issues of sexual equality extend into their home. Also starring Judy Holliday and Tom Ewell.
